author: Adityo Poernomo
comment: Help me please, i want to use compass from this face complications but it didn't work, i don't know why. I really like this theme so i paid, i use fossil q explorist btw.

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content: Hi Adityo, you have to move your watch around, making an "eight", so the compass sensor will calibrate! Write to support@paulserver.com if not works.. Thank you!

author: Josh the Happy
comment: For some reason it 0 for noon and midnight. It should say 12 for both when using a 12 hour face and should only say 0 for midnight on 24.

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content: Hi Josh, noon/midnight time it's now fixed. Update your app! Thank you

author: Mike Reeves
comment: What happened?! You updated and now the font is different and the added complications are all over the place. Simplify. You had it right the first iteration. Now I've got a contact on the bottom right of my screen and a battery complication covering the hour.... I used to love this. I'll change review when you go back to the better version.

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content: Hi Mike, there was a regression for watches with a "chin" on the bottom. Fixed, you can now update your app. Thanks for notify us and let us know if it works!

author: TheRiffBender
comment: Was great before the update. Won't let me use complications without having me pay, again. Guess I'll just switch like everyone else has.

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content: Hi TheRiffBender, if you already pay for widgets in previous version, complications are just enabled, you don't have to pay again! Be sure you are connected to device and Internet connection is enabled, so the watch can check you already pay..

author: Sean Lynch
comment: Thought it would be great - "configurable" suggests AW 2.0 complications control - NOT so. So if you plunk down your $, don't plan on configuring your watch face complications. (update) A bump up in stars for new configurability, appreciate an active developer.

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content:
Hi Sean, yes, AW 2.0 complications control has not yet been implemented to ensure old 1.5 devices compatibility with only one App. But, good news, is in the works the AW 2.0 native version, with complications and so on!
Thank you for your review!

author: Giorgio VII
comment: This is my favourite watch face but it always crashes on my phone everytime I try to open it. Please help!

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content:
Hi, thank you! We are happy you like this watch face! 
Unfortunately your's is a known issue for android 4.4 and older phones. We will work to try to fix it on next release!

author: Drew Crabb
comment: Really like this watch face.  The only feature I'd like to see is tick marks for the analog setting.

author: Jaymi Gibbs
comment: I love this watch face. I just wish that it had compatibility with all complications and font customization.

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content: Hi Jaymi, Complications are now available! Update the App!

author: Daniel Halevi
comment: Please add the option to see tick marks, also 2.0 complications would be nice

author: Stefano Cirimele
comment: Not many options available, not even basic ones like notification count

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content: Hi Stefano, with latest update we added Complications for Wear 2.0... Update the app!

author: James Wood
comment: So far, so good. Like the look and easy to read. I do find that the star volume and speed slider screen is accidentally accessed too easily when not looking at the watch. I quite often check what time it is but have to dismiss that screen first. It would be great if I could choose to only configure this from the phone as an option in the phone app. Also, phone battery meter AND watch battery meter, not one or the other would be a great addition.

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content: Hi James, phone battery level widget is now available!

author: Corey Fowler
comment: Step counter doesn't match phone count, needs more customization

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content:
Hi Corey, recently was introduced the ability for the watch to record steps 
independently from the phone. I think it's more accurate and that's why they might not match.
As you can see, our counter matches with the original FIT watch face one.
Keeps on following us, we are working to add more customization.. thank you!

author: Joshua Christian
comment: Very good watch face, but just paid for premium and the compass does not work on watch.

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content: Hi Joshua, try to move your watch making an height.. It needs to be calibrated!

author: Chris Kane
comment: Love it, I just wish I could swop the battery meter from watch to phone battery :-)

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content:
Hi Chris,  I think it could be a new feature on the battery meter widget...
Thank you for your suggestion!

author: cutitas cutit
comment: nice watch face but if there is any chance  that the widgets to be modify, they are ugly to be both on the bottom and  sqare or so cheers

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content:
Hi, is in the works the 2.0 AW version with more customization.. Keep following us!
Thank you

author: Family Tablet
comment: Scumbag dev doesn't  respond to multiple emails. Find me in your inbox  and  hit the reply button when you can be bothered to.  Poor customer service!

reply.author: paulserver.com
reply.content:
Hi, the address you can find in play store has an high antispam filter level, because it's a public generic address.
Please, contact our support center directly at support@paulserver.com - we will happy to help you!
